website_summaries.verdict: Brother's QL-1110NWB supports network and mobile protocols galore and prints to wide labels from PCs, Macs, or mobile devices. Handy software and a nifty mobile app make this a strong pick among pro label printers.
pros: Prints wide-format labels up to 4 inches
Fast enough for moderate-size label jobs
Good print quality for a label printer
Handy design, printing, and database software
cons: Consumables somewhat costly on a per-label basis
Can't print pre-designed labels from the unit itself

customer_reviews.title: Not a good commercial wireless printing option
customer_reviews.text: Not a good commercial wireless printing option. This printer does not actually print UPS, USPS or FedEx shipping labels you will need to edit the labels in the brother Ptouch editor to obtain the correct formatting, was on phone with brother support and they confirmed that formatting has been an issue with this model. Item has been returned for a different option outside of brother
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Difficult WiFi setup.  Works great when setup.
customer_reviews.text: If you use MAC address filtering as part of your network security, then continue reading. Brother does not list the max address anywhere on the device. You have to print a configuration page. Buried deep in the manual on a single line is the answer. Press and hold the scissor button for 2 seconds and it will print the 3 pages of configurations. Otherwise, setup is without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: engineer

customer_reviews.title: you are forced to use proprietary printing label from Brother
customer_reviews.text: what a joke? why are we being forced to use proprietary 4x6 label ONLY from brother? it's completely a waste
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: HASSLE FREE FOR SURE.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best! I previously had the smaller version of this printer that had the red print option, upgraded to this because I didn’t realize how small my shipping labels would be. •CONNECTABLE without the need for a computer. •I print straight from my phone. •Accepts a wide range of label paper roll sizes. •The app is easy to use. •Can connect via Bluetooth so you can use it on the go if you need to. I love it. You’ll love it. I print mostly shipping labels, most shipping companies make it easy to print to the correct size label. And if you switch out the label roll sizes, there is an auto detect function to remove the guesswork.
customer_reviews.author: bubba

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work with generic labels. Brother forces you to use their expensive Labels.
customer_reviews.text: Don't be fooled like me. After a couple hours on the phone with Brother's technical support, I have discovered the problem with this printer and why it stopped working. I ordered two of these and they both stopped working at the exact same time! This printer has a built-in sensor that can see when you are using after-market (generic) label rolls. It will let you use them for the first 60 days, after which it blocks your ability to print. You are then required to use the Brother genuine rolls, which are prohibitively expensive. There is no way to override the sensor. This has become a useless brick.
customer_reviews.author: jordan walker

customer_reviews.title: Mac 10.15 users beware!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a new MacBook Pro 2019 model - I am good with computers and setting up things like this. I was able to get the basic printing to work from usb cord and from my phone. BUT I needed it Wi-fi on my MacBook and after an hour or trying - Brother told me that they do not currently have an update for newer computers on 10.15 and you can not even download P-Touch Editor (which I would need to adjust and print my Amazon FBA labels). So if you need wifi on laptop or P-touch editor, most likely you can't get it. They have no idea when or if an update will come thru.
customer_reviews.author: tracy carrothers

customer_reviews.title: P-O-C  DEVICE and or FIRMWARE
customer_reviews.text: Almost a year old. sits on my desk NON FUNCTIONAL. I printed about 50 labels to date. Unit now just sitting there in the same spot with an error code. Yes ive tried all the usual diagnostic checks. "Cover Open". but of course the cover is closed no one has touched it in a year.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Mills

customer_reviews.title: Dos not work with an iPad Wireless
customer_reviews.text: No matter what I tired this printer would not show in Airprint. Not once. Called Brother, they had no idea what to do. Tried Amazon customer support, and they couldn't get it to work. Even tried eBay, and they don't even support printing on this printer. Don't believe the marketing hype...just walk away and look at something else.
customer_reviews.author: Not a Xerox Fan

customer_reviews.title: Using it for poshmark, vinted, etc.
customer_reviews.text: What I like about this most is that I can print from my phone. There’s not many options for wireless shipping label printers so this is the next best option on the market. I wish i can just click print instead of having to use their app and crop the labels...that’s the only downfall of it I have so far. There should be better technology for these type of machines. It haven’t been updated for years it seems like.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver
customer_reviews.text: I do reselling as a business and this is absolutely awesome. I set it up without the manuals and started printing within 10 minutes of setting it up. I went for this one over Dymo and Rollo or whatever it's called because of the bluetooth. I love that I can print labels and not be required to own a computer or to have all the wires everywhere. This is honestly one of the best decisions I made in 2018! I am even thinking of doing a giveaway of one because people need to know more about this product. I stand behind it 100000%.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn P.

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer!
customer_reviews.text: We use this product for shipping for our business and it is amazing!!! Very easy to use for us but everyone is different. Nothing that I don’t like about it so far. 10-11-2020 update. Still have had no issues with printer and have printed out many different types of shipping labels and even made long skinny labels to put on objects to teach our daughters 😁
customer_reviews.author: robert alvarado

customer_reviews.title: best wifi thermal shipping label printer
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for wifi thermal shipping label printer but they are all expensive... yes, very expensive. there's no reason this kind of printers need to be expensive these days. I decided to try this Brother QL-1110NWB if it is worth of shot, and it is yes and no. 1. Fast printing 2. Wireless 3. Bluetooth! YES Bluetooth! 4. easy to set up / VERY EASY Cons 1. EXPENSIVE! 2. Shipping label roller is type DK-1241, not the label roller normally use. 3. label roller DK-1241 is expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Analyzer

customer_reviews.title: BE AWARE!!!
customer_reviews.text: this printer will only work with brother labels and nothing else. your UPS, FEDEX, USPS, TNT, DHL and any other courier labels will not work. you also cannot buy any other labels elsewhere as this printer needs a "special" mark on the back, otherwise it simply cannot read and will not print. see how much you print and do the math compared to any other brand/printer that can work with "any" label. i returned mine and found a much better deal.
customer_reviews.author: charlie chaplin

customer_reviews.title: A must have for small online retailers
customer_reviews.text: I really needed something that would work with my smartphone and Shopify. This printer was a little tricky to set up at first (I could never get Bluetooth to work the way I needed it to) I have it working with wifi and it is a godsend! I love that it has a small footprint and makes creating shipping labels so much easier for my small business. So happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: Ice + Dust Pottery

customer_reviews.title: This is the one to get for small business
customer_reviews.text: This is the postage printer I really wanted for a long time. I have 2 other networked brother label printers, but they couldnt print 6inch fedex labels. Then i saw this with more features, lower cost. This is the printer to get. No special software required, just the driver.
customer_reviews.author: Seymore B

customer_reviews.title: Insanely difficult to install, but works AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: Took me 3 days and around 4 1/2 total hours on the phone with tech support to get this thing hooked upto my WiFi. I literally almost sent it back but the customer service rep called me back and some “expert” was able to help me (2 hour troubleshooting call.) However, now that it’s set up, it’s wonderful! I really needed a wireless shipping label printer for my business that I could print from my phone or downstairs computer and this works excellent! My only complaint is that it was a bear to set up, and very pricey. But I do love it and use it daily!
customer_reviews.author: LCat

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This has been the perfect solution for my online business! I never write reviews, but I’m so happy with this purchase that I felt inclined. It’s the only wireless 4x6 label printer I could find, but I’m so glad I did. Easy to use on eBay, Pirate Ship and Bonanza. I print from my iPhone with a single tap, no setting up label sizes or redoing anything after resetting the defaults once. Labels are clear. Saves so much time versus taping everything. I had no problems setting it up on my network either. Couldn’t be more pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Slingz

customer_reviews.title: Super Happy with this!
customer_reviews.text: We were using a regular inkjet printer to print out shipping labels on a 2-labels per page sheet. Our inkjet was slow and the ink would run if the packages happened to get wet from rain or dropping them on the ground. This thing rocks. It prints very fast and the labels stick really well; at least the labels right from Brother. It was kind of a spendy solution for our needs but really works great.
customer_reviews.author: C. M.

customer_reviews.title: Require$ Proprietary Label Roll$
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! I thought printer companies were only scamming customers with replacement ink cartridges, but Brother has taken the game to a new level. Aside from label rolls that are a good bit more expensive, it's a terrible choice environmentally. So wasteful to introduce a disposable plastic component for no reason but profit.
customer_reviews.author: Digital

customer_reviews.title: Great Wi-Fi Printer
customer_reviews.text: It is the best wi-fi printer I've used. Only issue is auto label cutter stops working.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Mizuki

customer_reviews.title: Good luck!
customer_reviews.text: This product didn't work after 12 hrs. I'm very tech savvy and truthfully it was a nightmare to set up. After the setup the machine printed fine and the following day the machine went offline and stopped working. After making an appointment to speak with with customer service and trouble shoot the unit the agent determined the machine didn't work and there were none in stock so I got a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Brialgon

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Bought 3 of these a year ago. Was considering much more expensive printer, but this prints custom labels perfectly. Not a single problem, and once setup, (which was fairly easy), all that needs done is paper changes, which take about 1 second. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: The BEST SHIPPING LABEL PRINTER FOR YOUR BUSINESS.
customer_reviews.text: The best thermal printer hand down. The only thermal shipping label printer that has Bluetooth and wireless. I had to return all the other printer because they will not let me print my shipping label from me phone which was a big inconvenience. This printer is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: rita williams

customer_reviews.title: Best Wireless shipping Label printer
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer so much. Easy to setup... can uses with stamps.com, eBay, UPS and etc. my main reason for buying it is that it is wireless. Before getting this I had the dymo 4 XL printer. Dymo is good also but this printer took it to another level.
customer_reviews.author: Momof3

customer_reviews.title: Forces you to use their EXPENSIVE special labels
customer_reviews.text: I returned this within 1 hour of opening it. You have to use their special proprietary labels that come on a cartridge piece to print labels. The cost of this labels is over 10 times a comparable label. If you are a business, do not buy this. Stick with Zebra.
customer_reviews.author: FiveDogBakery

customer_reviews.title: Perfect once headache setup is completed!
customer_reviews.text: Set up was a bit of a headache. Took my husband and I a few searches on the internet to get it set up with Evay shipping. But now that's it's set up it is perfect for printing shipping labels from Ebay store. Exactly what we needed!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: worth it
customer_reviews.text: best investment I ever made in my business, this was the last seller so over I could find this exact printer, everywhere else was sold out and this one was 100 more on here but totally worth it

customer_reviews.title: Ez pz
customer_reviews.text: So you like print labels huh? Well here you go!
customer_reviews.author: NonyaBiznizz

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this about 45 days, just outside of the Amazon return window, and it stopped working in the middle of a print job. Hours of troubleshooting and uninstalling/reinstalling and this printer is nothing but a red blinking light. Incredibly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah W.

customer_reviews.title: Great machine! Love the wifi option
customer_reviews.text: Great machine once you get it set up. Only crappy thing is you have to use proprietary labels, but you can find third party ones that work way cheaper than brothers.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install - Works Great
customer_reviews.text: There are some slight challenges to installing on a Mac but if you read the directions closely it is very easy to in stall on a network and access from several computers. Prints great Fedex labels when you print in Landscape mode, perfect size labels.

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking
customer_reviews.text: Customer service....what is that? Brother doesn't want to talk to anyone. We bought this printer so we could print printing labels and many hours wasted and we could not reach brother to help
customer_reviews.author: Erik Zehne

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: What a great printer to have if you are doing online sales. Works great and easy to link to your computer or phone, wirelessly!
customer_reviews.author: dalehan123

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Actually I wrote original review but amazon did not showed...then realized all negative reviews will not show up here. But any way at first it's terrible to set up almost frustrating but once you got it set up it's nice. I can print from my phone all the shipping labels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer, easy networking
customer_reviews.text: Great printer, easy to set up and network. We bought some un-official labels and had an issue with one roll that the printer was not recognizing where each label ended, but that must have been a defective roll (you get what you pay for with off brand stuff) highly recommend this printer for anyone looking for an easy network option, wifi, LAN etc. Our whole office prints to it.

customer_reviews.title: Having a computer of some sort is necessary
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed, works for printing postage for eBay and Poshmark. Set up was a bit confusing and it doesn’t always stay on the correct wireless network but overall I’m very pleased. Any issue I’ve had is usually easily resolved by turning it on and off

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: After all me research.....I did not read anywhere that is was NOT Bluetooth compatible with iOS and chrome book. Also not WiFi compatible with chrome book. I was very disappointed when I learned that. I did hear that they are working on getting this fixed. And those were the main reasons I purchased this printer. I works great from my iPhone after I switch the WiFi to the printer every time I need to print a label.
customer_reviews.author: Sockmonkey_42

customer_reviews.title: fast, quiet and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: very easy to setup and use, I setup wired and bluetooth for my wife's computer and cellphone, she prints ebay and other labels wirelessly, without problems

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this is my first time ever shipping label machine and I didn’t want to spend this much money on it BUT let me tell you!! This is AMAZING! So easy to use( watched a set-up video on YouTube) and it prints in a second. Connects to WiFi. So much better than printing it out! Well worth the $$$$. I would def buy again! I normally don’t even write reviews but this is that amazing!

customer_reviews.title: The Most expensive but The Best
customer_reviews.text: Wifi option works flawlessly and only takes a few seconds to set up. If you want the best this is it. Would buy again.

customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer to print labels and would recommend this to anyone interested.

customer_reviews.title: I will never go back to zebra
customer_reviews.text: Thank goodness somebody made an alternative to Zebras overpriced and overcomplicated printers

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.text: A++ This printer is amazing and extremely easy to use. Second one I’ve purchased for my business. 100’s of labels can be printed in a matter of minutes even from your iPhone. Thanks brother :)

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use and great quality, you can trust the brand stable to use

The only thing that bugs me is the UPS courier service delayed me for a week before they deliver the package to me.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. It shortens the time of shipping and printing by half.

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous printer! No issues whatsoever. Easy setup! Easy to use! Super super super fast. This is awesome for our business.

customer_reviews.title: Well made, versitile. Excellant online support.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to replace a ql-720. Which I gave my kids. This lable maker can input from many platforms but only one at a time.!

customer_reviews.title: Falsely advertised that it could print Amazon labels
customer_reviews.text: I tried everything to try and print Amazon return labels on this labeler but had no luck. Researched if there was software to download, changed the size to 4x6. I tried everything but nothing worked. If you're looking for a labeler to print shipping labels from Amazon, this is not the one to buy.

product_meta.title: Brother QL-1110NWB Wide Format, Postage and Barcode Professional Thermal Label Printer with Wireless Connectivity
product_meta.description:
The Brother QL-1110NWB Wide Format Professional Thermal Label Printer addresses the increasing demand for highly reliable, cost-effective label printers to consistently and quickly print high-quality paper labels for packages, file folders, name badges, postage, shipping and more. The Brother QL-1110NWB Label Printer can print up to 4-inch labels which are ideal for shipping, addressing and postage needs. The Brother QL-1110NWB delivers 300 dpi resolution and prints up to 69 labels per minute(2) minimizing the time spent waiting for labels. Its built-in automatic heavy-duty cutter is ideal for handling large print jobs and provides a clean, professional edge when using continuous tapes.

The Brother QL-1110NWB label printer offers flexible connectivity, featuring Bluetooth wireless technology, (Ver.2.1+EDR SPP, BIP, OPP, HCRP and iAP/MFI supported) Wired Ethernet and Wireless (802.11b/g/n) interfaces. This makes connecting and printing from mobile devices simple. You can create and print labels from your mobile device when connected to a wireless network.(1) It also offers a USB host interface for use with peripheral devices including scanners.

The Brother QL-1110NWB includes a USB cable, label creation software and a starter supply of labels so it’s ready to use right out of the box. The QL-1110NWB is compatible with Windows and Mac and integrates with Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. The Plug & Play feature enables you to create and print labels without the need to install software on your Windows PC, making it simple to use. The easy-to-use, drop-in DK replacement tape rolls make it a breeze to change supplies. There’s no ink or toner to replace – ever. The Brother QL-1110NWB also detects the size of the tape in the machine and automatically adjusts the onscreen template.

The automatic crop function lets on-line sellers easily print product and other barcode labels from A4/Letter size label sheet templates (Windows only). You can print an entire sheet of labels or a section of labels with virtually no waste. Brother network management tools make it easy to integrate and manage the label printer on any network. The free Software Development Kit (SDK) is available for Windows, iOS and Android for custom application development. Brother provides email and phone support to developers and software integrators. The Brother QL-1110NWB combines fast and easy professional output with the low-maintenance requirements of direct thermal printing.

(1) Requires connection to a wireless network. For more details regarding the Brother iPrint&Label app visit manufacturer’s website.
(2) Based on using standard address labels, text only at 300 x 300 dpi

All referenced trademarks and registered trademarks are the property of their respective companies. Android is a trademark of Google Inc. Mac and all other Apple trademarks mentioned are registered trademarks of Apple Inc. The Bluetooth word mark and logos are registered trademarks owned by the Bluetooth SIG, Inc. and any use of such marks by Brother is under license. Other trademarks and trade names are those of their respective owners. Operation Modes: PC Connected, Stand Alone (ESC/P or P-touch Template)
feature_bullets: PRINTS ON WIDE FORMAT LABELS UP TO 4” WIDE: Perfect for printing mailing, address and postage labels for packages along with visitor and name badges
CONNECTIVITY & WIRELESS PRINTING: Bluetooth wireless technology, Ethernet or Wireless (802. 11b/g/n) interfaces; print wirelessly from mobile devices(1)

BARCODE CROP FUNCTION: No more printing sheets of barcodes. Now, easily crop and select barcodes and UPCs for printing from templates (Windows only).Database File Compatibility: CSV, Microsoft SQL Server Database (Windows), TXT, MDB, XLS

Operating system : Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8/8. 1, Windows 10; Server 2008/2008 R2/2012/2012 R2/2016; Mac OS X 10. 11 - 10. 13. x . “PLUG & LABEL” FEATURE: Lets you create and print labels without the need to install software on Windows PCs

NETWORK MANAGEMENT TOOLS & FREE SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT KITS (SDK): Easily integrate & manage via network, free SDKs for Windows, iOS & Android systems. Maximum Label Length: 9. 8 Feet (USB) 3 feet (Serial)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars197 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
